FuncDef:
The as number command sets the number of an autonomous system (AS) domain to which an AS edge router (AER) belongs.
The undo as number command deletes the AS number so that the binding between an AER and an AS with the specified ID is removed.
By default, no AS number is specified to an AER, and the AER belongs to no AS.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of an AS to which an AER belongs.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

ExtraInfo: An AER is a router at the edge of an AS. Each member AS in a trust alliance consists of multiple AERs, and each AER can only belong to a single AS. To set a number of an AS to which an AER belongs, run the as number command in the SMA view displayed using the sma command.
